user_question: Can you explain the concept of biomimicry in architecture and generate an image of a building inspired by nature?
final_answer: Biomimicry in architecture involves designing buildings inspired by natural forms and processes. Image of a building inspired by nature generated. A famous example is the Eastgate Centre in Harare, Zimbabwe, which uses a natural cooling system inspired by termite mounds.
